com.clarionmedia.infinitum.ui.context.impl

Class DataEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.event.AbstractEvent
      • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.ui.context.impl.DataEvent

  • public class DataEvent
extends AbstractEvent

    Concrete implementation of AbstractEvent representing the notion of a "data event", which is the creation, modification, or deletion of an entity. A DataEvent signals to the UI that it potentially needs to be updated. For example, if an entity is deleted in Activity A and then Activity B, which contains a list of entities, is resumed, the deleted entity should be removed from the list in Activity B.

    DataEvents are added to event queues that belong to each registered EventPublisher. When an Activity or Fragment lifecycle event is published, such as onCreate, onStart, or onResume, the DataEvents in the queue will be consumed, possibly resulting in a UI update.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 01/14/13
    Author:
    Tyler Treat
    See Also:
    LifecycleEvent
